sv.projects.listperfcomp

Class PerformanceComparator

  • java.lang.Object
    • sv.projects.listperfcomp.PerformanceComparator

  • public class PerformanceComparator
extends java.lang.Object
    Entry point to the List Concurrent Performance Comparator that measures performance of different types of lists - CopyOnWriteArrList, SynchronizedRandomAccessList, ArrayList, LinkedList, ... - in the case when the Lists are accessed by two concurrent threads performing get() or add() actions.
    The Comparator has got an interactive command-line menu through which it is possible to :
    • show current configuration on the screen
    • update current configuration
    • run tests and show average results for lists under tests
    • the following list types can be selected for test :
      • CopyOnWriteArrList
      • SynchronizedRandomAccessList
      • ArrayList
      • LinkedList

    Concurrent performance test description

    Mechanism of retrieving data
    Two Callable threads perform a selected action (access or add) on first and second halves of a list respectively. Submitting the threads to newFixedThreadPool and starting them simultaneously via CountDownLatch. The threads will compete to perform the action on the assigned part of the list.

    Further data processing
    The results time is aggregated separately for each thread of each list under test. Then averages are calculated in ms and formatted results are printed out.
    Example:
              CopyOnWriteArrayList, size [1000]  -  action: get()  |  thread 1 :       2 ms  |  thread 2 :       2 ms
  SynchronizedRandomAccessList, size [1000]  -  action: get()  |  thread 1 :      11 ms  |  thread 2 :      13 ms

    JUnit tests

    JUnit tests are covering a part of functionality.
    Since:
    2021-05-01
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    S.V.
